verbs.description: befoul (third-person singular simple present befouls, present participle befouling, simple past and past participle befouled)

entries.meaning: To make foul; to soil; to contaminate, pollute.
examples: At last, what with a round of blasphemy, and the whole crowd with clay pistols belching smoke and fire and slander of their neighbours, and the floor already befouled with dregs and spittle, I feared lest viler deeds should happen, and craved to depart.

entries.meaning: (specifically) To defecate on, to soil with excrement.
examples: For its an ill Bird will befoule her own Nest  […]

entries.meaning: (figuratively) To stain or mar (for example with infamy or disgrace).
examples: For three days Pete bore himself according to his wont, thinking to silence the evil tongues of the little world about him, and keep sweet and alive the dear name which they were waiting to befoul and destroy.

entries.meaning: To entangle or run against so as to impede motion.
